data.title: Excellent
data.text: I have eaten at the Lion's den many times and it is always excellent. The atmosphere is very nice and the owners and wait staff are SUPER!!!

data.title: Good time for NewYears eve
data.text: Name has changed to Rock n Robin. Needed to be better organized,some  waitresses and waiters didn't know which were their tables. Management figuring out the lighting while ppl ate, limited menu had a very broad selection,excellent food, we had filet and steak and peppers with side of spaghetti. Pork and sauerkraut at midnight smelled and looked delicious, we didn't stay to eat it but told by other friends who did that it was very good. Everyone had an individual  bottle of champaign. Bar had only 2 bartenders, I drank the same drink all night and each time mixed different. We did enjoy ourselves, overlooked some things as it was New Year's Eve.

data.title: Great  Place!!
data.text: Visiting my daughter from Florida , went to Lion's Den , what a beautiful place -had so much fun  went back the next night , music and people were wondeful, barterder was so nice , met the owner very friendly ,and nice man.  Good food too !! This place is really an upscale restaurant !!

data.title: Wednesday night treat!
data.text:
We had dinner at The Lion's Den with another couple.  It was the first visit for the four of us, but we will return!  All of us were happy with or meal selections.  Pork chops were moist, scallops were huge and tasty, pasta and chicken selections were delicious!  The Italian decor was fun!   A couple of fountains, several rooms and updated atmosphere!
But the best surprise was the entertainment!  During our entire meal, and drinks at the bar following, we were entertained by Shar!  She sang a huge selection of songs, ranging from Dionne Warwick to Patsy Cline.  The music was never too loud to distract us from visiting with our friends, but also perfect to sit back and enjoy!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: The Lion's Den is a fabulous new restraurant. The decor is modern with wonderful live music  entertainment. Chef Rob is outstanding with his delicous creations. Everything about this restraurant is outstanding! You need visit this lovely new place! You will NOT be disappointed. A+'s We took some of our friends and they loved it!

data.title: Good food, crazy atmosphere
data.text: A small group of us went for dinner. Word of mouth told us that the food here was good. And indeed the food was very good, all except one of us thought their meal was delicious. Presentation, temperature, accompanying sides were all done well. Our server was very polite, but not a very good waitress, hopefully she will get better with experience. But, I have to tell you, the Lion's Den is trying too hard to entertain, when the food alone will bring people downtown. Here is what they had going on the night we were there. Greeting staff dressed in Mardi Gras masks, a violin player who started inside then was on the sidewalk outside when we left, a table-side magician doing card tricks, live piano music and singing, disco lights bouncing off the walls all night long. With a full restaurant and a full bar in the dining area it was so noisy at times that it was difficult to talk, not the relaxing evening we envisioned. I may go back for lunch because, like I said, the food was very good.

data.title: wow wow big city feeling felt like vaction
data.text: nice place real good food fun nice music a must see canton best by far we stop by one friday had the crab cakes they were great and i lived in boston no fillers all crab wife had the pasta a big hit we will be back best  hzad in years

data.title: Bad Dining Experience.
data.text:
We chose to go here based on an article in the Canton Repository. Our experience couldn't have been further from what we read in that article. Here are some good comments, but mostly bad.
Street to sidewalk right in front of the door not cleared of snow. 
Visible lipstick stains on two different glasses on two different tables. (Ours, and later saw that the table next to us sent one away for the same reason.)
The salads were nice, and were a good size.
Mediterranean stuffed chicken was very dry, and was supposed to have feta cheese, but this could not be seen or tasted. The mashed potatoes looked grey, and were in a ball, and were also very dry. 
The “Shrimp Fahrenheit” is supposed to be extra large and coated in their "special spicy Cajun sauce". They were large, which was nice... but the sauce was merely buffalo wing sauce. We actually found this to be funny, and are still making jokes about it. We'd rather still be talking about how awesome that "special spicy Cajun sauce" was! 
The chicken parmesan was ok, but the spaghetti was just run of the mill, and seemed a bit over-cooked, watery on the plate, and not much of it either. 
The bread seemed good-fresh and warm, but they put it on a plate with all of the butter packets, and to me, this just does not seem sanitary.
Our waitress didn't know anything about the menu or any of the dishes. She said she was just there helping for the night, and didn't actually work there. The place was relatively busy, but far from full. We saw at least 12 different staff members, not including the kitchen staff, so not sure why extra help was needed to start with. The table that sat down next to us seemed to know the owners, and seemed to have really excellent and much quicker service. 
There is even more bad, and not very much more good... but this gives a gist of our experience.
Our waitress was very nice, and apologized to us for things being slow, and for her being there just helping out. The cleanliness and food were obviously not her fault. 
There are so many choices of places to eat in the whole Akron/Canton area, We expect places to be clean, food to be good, and dining experiences to be good. In our case at the Lion's Den, it wasn't. We won't be going back there again.

data.title: Great menu, personal service
data.text: Went for birthday celebration....Tino, the owner's son was our waiter and made sure everything was done to our taste, a steak so rare if mooed!  Interesting entertainment, a singer in one part of the restaurant and a tuxedo clad violin player.  Rack of lamb fantastic.   Give this downtown venue a try for dinner.

data.title: Lion's den a welcome downtown addition
data.text: My companion and I visited for dinner before the theatre, and were well-pleased with the experience. Seating and service were prompt and courteous, and attentive throughout. The menu and wine selection are varied without being over-ambitious. Live music first featured a talented fiddler playing a selection of Xmas tunes, followed by a pianist-singer, who played traditional vocal hits. If you arrive before 6p, make sure you park in the above-ground garage. Do not enter the adjacent underground garage (Charter One Bank). Your vehicle will be locked-in until the next morning !

data.title: Went for the Entertainment, will return for the Food
data.text: My understanding is this restaurant has only been open about 2 months.  We went there to hear the live entertainment, Cajun Butter, but will return for the food.  The food was wonderful and well priced with very good servings.  The service, by Chris was top notch. The menu is varied, there is something for everyone.  I love that they have entertainment on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. I truly think it enhances my dinner experience to have good music with it.  Chris suggested a bottle of wine and it did not dissappoint. They mentioned that they are also open for lunch and have 20 items under $7.00.  I wish I worked closer.  I had the Drunkun Chicken with freshly made pasta and my husband had the French Cut Pork Chop with a very nice bottle of wine the dinner was about $70.00. Serving was so plentiful I had enough for lunch the next day.  Would highly recommend this restaurant.
